A government report finds that low income people who live in states that have not expanded Medicaid are much less likely to get medical care than poor people in other states the government Accountability Office in partnership with the national
Center for Health Statistics is that what the results of a survey conducted in two thousand sixteen they surveyed low income adults ages Nineteen sixty four notable findings include nearly twenty percent of poor people in states that did not expand Medicaid said they opted not to get medical care in previous twelve months because they could not afford it
That's twenty percent compared to nine point four percent of poor people in those states that did expand Medicaid
